image.altText: A framed picture of a man on a glass table

props.synopsis: When Yuval heard the shots ring out, he jumped out of his car and raced into the fray. But a tragic case of mistaken identity left him bleeding to death on the street.

title.children: An Israeli reservist thought he killed a Hamas terrorist. The man's true identity has rocked a nation

image.altText: Rita Saffioti speaking at a podium at a media conference indoors, wearing a lilac jacket and pants.

props.synopsis: A $3.7 billion surplus is an impressive figure for Mark McGowan's successor as Treasurer, Rita Saffioti, but there are loud calls for the government to use the money to help people doing it tough, writes state political reporter Keane Bourke.Â

title.children: The WA government delivers another record surplus, but not everyone is feeling the effects

image.altText: Composite image of I-Medical Director Ashley Yong and an image of its restructuring report.

props.synopsis: A country medical service facing liquidation angers creditors by offering them 30 per cent of what they are owed to escape a half-a-million-dollar debt while pushing ahead with plans for a new clinic.

title.children: Outback medical service angers creditors after pushing ahead with a third GP clinic while owing thousands in wages

image.altText: Karate instructor Gavin Smith enters Perth District Court

props.synopsis: A senior Perth karate instructor who sexually abused a teenage student and then threatened to kill her if she reported it to police, is sentenced to eight years jail.

title.children: Perth karate instructor jailed for sexually abusing teenage student

image.altText: Flood damage Innisfail

props.synopsis: Police say the man's house in Degarra has been "washed away" with no sign of him since Sunday, as the region begins to clean up after the flood disaster.

title.children: Missing man's home 'washed away' in Far North Queensland flood as police finally reach cut-off towns

image.altText: A collage of two silhouettes, the KPMG logo, and cutouts of $100 notes.

props.synopsis: A Defence data project involving a $100 million contract issued to KPMG is rife with serious governance failures, conflicts of interests and a "lack of accountability", according to an external review.

title.children: Controversial consulting giant KPMG charged Defence twice for same work, review finds

image.altText: A woman in a brightly colored headscarf, sitting on the floor surrounded by food, looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: A pristine island in Indonesia is under threat from Indonesia's nickel rush, with some women now having to walk for kilometres just to access clean water. But locals are fighting back.

title.children: A pristine island is under threat in Indonesia but locals are fighting back

image.altText: The Galaxy Leader cargo ship is escorted by Houthi boats in the Red Sea in this photo released November 20, 2023.

props.synopsis: Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen have fired missiles at container ships in the Red Sea.Â As one of the world's major trade routes closes, there are fears it could derail a fragile global economy.

title.children: Is the global economy at risk as Houthi attacks disrupt Red Sea shipping and world trade?

image.altText: Israeli soldiers sit in an armored vehicle near the border of the Gaza Strip.

props.synopsis: Israeli forces raided one of the last functioning hospitals in Gaza's north and bombarded the south with air-strikes that killed at least 28 Palestinians, pressing ahead with their offensive Tuesday with renewed backing from the United States, despite rising international alarm.

title.children: One of Gaza's last functioning hospitals raided by Israeli forces

image.altText: Gina Rinehart speaking into a micorphone in front of a backgorund with trees and grass.

props.synopsis: Australia's richest woman, Gina Rinehart, says the revenue from federal corporate tax paid by mining companies more than covers the cost of salaries of all of Australia's police, teachers and nurses. RMIT ABC Fact Check runs the numbers.

title.children: We fact checked Gina Rinehart on the size of federal taxation revenue from mining. Here's what we found

image.altText: A young white woman sitting with her service dog in a park. The dog is a border collie and they are both smiling

props.synopsis: A Sydney woman is taking Qantas to the Federal Court after the airline refused to allow her assistance dog on a flight.

title.children: Strike the assistance dog has changed his owner's life, but Qantas won't let him fly

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The ASX200 is tipped to open higher, following another positive trading session on Wall Street overnight. Follow live.Â

title.children: Australian stocks to open higher, Wall Street has another positive session

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Super Consumers Australia wins advocacy role
Joint statement from the United States, Australia, New Zealand, and Partner Nations on Houthi attacks in the Red Sea
Mitchell Starc and Pat Cummins smash IPL auction records, raking in more than $8 million combined

image.altText: Two male cricket players in Australia kit embrace and celebrate.

props.synopsis: Australia captain Pat Cummins smashes the Indian Premier League auction bidding, going for a record price, only for compatriot Mitchell Starc to top that mark hours later.

title.children: Mitchell Starc smashes Patrick Cummins's briefly-held IPL auction price record in mega-money night

image.altText: A young woman wearing a blue shirt stares sadly at the camera

props.synopsis: Mount Isa's Gemma Catchpole is proud to call the outback home, but feels let down by authorities after being targeted by thieves. She's calling for victims to "stand together" and demand action on youth crime.

title.children: Mum of three left 'broken' after both family cars stolen while husband navigates brain cancer treatment

image.altText: Coastal road, beach at sunset, country road Cape Bridgewater

props.synopsis: The ABC understands two teenage boys were exploring rock pools at Cape Bridgewater when a 14-year-old was hit by a wave and swept out to sea last night.

title.children: Search to resume for missing teenage boy swept off rocks on Victoria's west coast

image.altText: An older man with a silver beard and long grey hair sits in a garden next to a middle-aged man of Vietnamese background.

props.synopsis: Martin and Kim are running buddies with very different backgrounds, but that difference doesn't get in their way.

title.children: Why Martin never asked why his friend was sleeping rough

image.altText: A seal rubs up against a white car.

props.synopsis: He has won over the public with his roly-poly antics, with tens of thousands of followers on social media pages set up in his honour â but "Neil the seal" is providing authorities in Tasmania with a conundrum.

title.children: Who is Neil the seal â and why is his social media stardom a problem?

image.altText: A serious young girl with large eyes, large glasses, dark blonde hair, bangs leans into a serious older women wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: AÂ cough is necessary to keep the airways clear and to remove foreign particles such as dust. But respiratory experts say coughs that linger need to be investigated.Â  Here's what to look for in kids and adults.

title.children: Have a cough you can't shake? Get checked to see if it's caused by something serious, say doctors

image.altText: An orange wall with City of Joondalup written next to the logo and white writing "Leisure Centre" underneath.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old Perth man who frequented two northern suburbs leisure centres so he could repeatedly make indecent recordings of young children in the change rooms is jailed.

title.children: Predator used school newsletters to plan pool visits so he could record naked children, court told

image.altText: An aerial photo of a sandalwood plantation next to an irrigation channel

props.synopsis: Sandalwood giant Quintis has taken action on its plantations in the face of millions of dollars in losses.

title.children: World's largest sandalwood producer winds up 30 per cent of plantations after review finds them 'unviable'

props.synopsis: Lip-reading expert Tim Reedy gives evidence on CCTV of Bruce Lehrmann and Brittany Higgins speaking at a bar on the night of her alleged rape at Parliament House.

title.children: Brittany Higgins said 'I don't want to' when Bruce Lehrmann told her to finish drink, lip-reader tells Federal Court

image.altText: Scientists in orange hi-vis stand in front of lava explosion

props.synopsis: The volcano, north-east of the town of GrindavÃ­k, leaves scientists puzzled as it looks to stabilise. See the pictures of its eruption.Â

title.children: Tourists flock to see 'once-in-a-lifetime' eruption of Iceland's GrindavÃ­k volcano

image.altText: A middle-aged white man with dark hair in a suit stands behind a lectern in front of two red and white Canadian flags.

props.synopsis: The move sparks pushback from Canada's automobile industry, which says the regulations are too ambitious andÂ the country's charging network is incomplete.

title.children: Canada says all cars and trucks must be zero-emission by 2035

image.altText: A mix of cars and trucks fill four lanes of peak hour traffic on freeway.

props.synopsis: A sustainable city expert says, "it's increasingly the case that if you build more around cars, you drive the economy down" as rapidly growing regional cities grapple with long-term solutions to transport.

title.children: Regional cities with transit systems 'designed around utes' destined to die, transport expert warns

image.altText: Orange scooters parked on a CBD street on a grey overcast day.

props.synopsis: Doctors want better regulation of e-scooters as a new study shows one Melbourne hospital spent $1.9 million in one year treating injuries from the devices.

title.children: Surgeon calls for greater regulation of e-scooters as injuries rise

image.altText: Writer Hannah Diviney outside, smiling as she looks into the distance, her hair blowing in the wind. Wearing a green t shirt.

props.synopsis: In the busyness of everyday life, writer and disability advocate Hannah Diviney is prioritising fun. She's also found ways to switch off, with meditation and the latest Taylor Swift commentary.

title.children: The counting exercise Hannah Diviney uses when she needs to hit pause

image.altText: Carol Sandland in a green shirt, looking straight at the camera out the front of a building.

props.synopsis: A Canberra nurse sacked for sharing confidential patient information with a union is awarded compensation, despite her employers having a "well-founded" reason for her dismissal.

title.children: Canberra nurse awarded compensation after she was sacked for sharing confidential patient information with union

image.altText: Natasha Fyles during a press conference announcing her resignation.

props.synopsis: After the resignation of Natasha Fyles as chief minister, who is in the running to take over the job of running the Northern Territory?

title.children: The NT chief minister has resigned. Who might replace her and what happens next?

image.altText: A close up shot of Anthony Albanese from below.

props.synopsis: The prime minister urges hope for peaceful recognition of a Palestinian state alongside Israel in an end of year address, even as Israeli officials openly reject the prospect.

title.children: Don't 'abandon hope' for two-state solution between Israel and Palestine, prime minister urges

image.altText: Two elves sit on tinsel in front of a hi-vis vest and a note that says Santa will be coming early

props.synopsis: Members of families tackling shiftwork and a fly-in-fly-out lifestyle can often miss out on Christmas festivities, but with a little festival season magic, and lot of preparation, these Australians are making it work.

title.children: FIFO parents share their tips for families separated at Christmas
